result.execSummary:
All charges against Jessica A Lopez in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jessica A Lopez is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica A Lopez

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 08/23/2022.

Defendant Jessica A Lopez in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jessica A Lopez.  Attorney Melissa Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Both counsel discuss possible outcomes of case. 

Case moves to dismiss 22CM496 without prejudice, and requests that the Defendant have bond conditions modified on 22CM497 to include that she go to DHHS for evaluation for Mental Health and Medication. 

Defense agrees. 

Court conducts colloquy with Defendant re: competency. 

Based on Defendant's responses, the Court will withhold a competency finding today, set a status hearing and set a competency hearing. 

Court will dismiss 22CM496 without prejudice, and will modify the bond on 22CM497 include DHHS for evaluation for Mental Health and Medication. Defendant to be released forthwith.
Filed by Dr Matthew Seipel
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Order for Competency Examination By Department of Health Services.
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 07/11/2022
Review hearing on August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Jessica A Lopez in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    
Cour to Address:  Defense Motion to Withdraw.

Attorney Herbers presented statements to the court (Public Defender Appointed).
Defendant presented statements to the court.
If the court grants the withdrawal of counsel Public Defender will appoint new counsel.
Court Grants - Attorney Herbers is allowed to withdraw.
State Public Defender to appoint new counsel.

Court will again order a competency evaluation under 971.14.
Court will order the evaluation be conducted on an out-patient, in-custody basis.
Court will appoint WIS. Forensic Unit.
Court orders the evaluation be filed with the court by:  08/12/22

Court will quash the warrant.
Court orders the defendant remain in custody pending her competency evaluation.
Court will order the defendant released pending completion of her evaluation.  Review hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record, filed by Attorney Herbers.

Defendant Jessica A Lopez did not appear.    

Warrant remains active.
